p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d12 per Marauder level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per Marauder level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Shields. Weapons: Simple Lightweapons, Martial Lightweapons, Simple Blasters, Simple Vibroweapons, Martial Vibroweapons. Saving Throws: Strength and Constitution.
Skills. Choose 2 from Intimidation, Nature, Perception, Survival, Athletics.
Spell Save DC. 8 + Charisma modifier + Proficiency Bonus.
Rage. Rage is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. Functions identically to a Monk's Ki Points. You always start with max Rage after any rest.

description.p: Rage is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. Functions identically to a Monk's Ki Points. You always start with max Rage after any rest.
Your Rage increases as you gain levels.

sheet.description: You have {{rage:max}} Rage points.

description.p: Use the Force to push someone away. Each creature in a 15-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

sheet.description: Use the Force to push someone away. Each creature in a 15-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

description.p: Use the Force to pull someone toward you. Each creature within a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and is pulled 10 feet closer. On a successful save, the creature take half damage and isn't pulled. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage, increases the cone size by 5 feet, and pulls creatures an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: Use the Force to pull someone toward you. Each creature within a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and is pulled 10 feet closer. On a successful save, the creature take half damage and isn't pulled. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage, increases the cone size by 5 feet, and pulls creatures an additional 5 feet.

description.p: Taunt an enemy you see within range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gets taunted so that when they try to attack anyone other than you, they have disadvantage. On a successful save, the creature isn't taunted.

sheet.description: Taunt an enemy you see within range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gets taunted so that when they try to attack anyone other than you, they have disadvantage. On a successful save, the creature isn't taunted.

description.p: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. This grants you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

sheet.description: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. This grants you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

description.p: You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within range. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target’s Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

sheet.description: You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within range. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target’s Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

description.p: Make a ranged attack of 30/60 with your melee weapon using your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls. If you are proficient with you weapon you add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), your range increases by 10/15 feet.

sheet.description: Make a ranged attack of 30/60 with your melee weapon using your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls. If you are proficient with you weapon you add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), your range increases by 10/15 feet.

description.p: Use the Force to push everyone around you away. Each creature within 5 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 energy damage and is pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 energy damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

sheet.description: Use the Force to push everyone around you away. Each creature within 5 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 energy damage and is pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 energy damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

description.p: Use the Force to choke a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not incapacitated. Your next turn you must use a Bonus Action to choke again or the target is released. The target must make another Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d8 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. On your third turn using this ability you must use a Bonus Action one last time or the target is released. The target must make a last Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 kinetic damage, but is no longer Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an addional 1d6 kinetic damage per choke.

sheet.description: Use the Force to choke a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not incapacitated. Your next turn you must use a Bonus Action to choke again or the target is released. The target must make another Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d8 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. On your third turn using this ability you must use a Bonus Action one last time or the target is released. The target must make a last Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 kinetic damage, but is no longer Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an addional 1d6 kinetic damage per choke.

description.p: Gain 10 movement speed when not wearing heavy armour.

sheet.description: Gain 10 movement speed when not wearing heavy armour.

description.p: Immune to being frightened.

sheet.description: Immune to being frightened.

description.p: Gain advantage on initiative rolls.

sheet.description: Gain advantage on initiative rolls.

description.p: Use the Force to electrocute a target within range. On hit, deals 2d8 lightning damage. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the attack deals an additional 1d8 damage.

sheet.description: Use the Force to electrocute a target within range. On hit, deals 2d8 lightning damage. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the attack deals an additional 1d8 damage.

description.p: Consume 3 Rage to gain an extra Action.

sheet.description: Consume 3 Rage to gain an extra Action.

description.p: When you take damage from a creature within melee distance, you can use a Reaction to strike back at them with a melee attack. You do not add your modifier to the damage.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature within melee distance, you can use a Reaction to strike back at them with a melee attack. You do not add your modifier to the damage.

description.p: If you drop to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 Rage to make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you are downed. On a successful save, your hit points become 2 × Marauder level. Each time you use this feature, the DC increases by 5 until a short rest.

sheet.description: If you drop to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 Rage to make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you are downed. On a successful save, your hit points become 2 × Marauder level. Each time you use this feature, the DC increases by 5 until a short rest.

description.p: Instill fear on a target by simply being there. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the target is not affected.

sheet.description: Instill fear on a target by simply being there. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the target is not affected.

description.p: When you roll initiative, gain 2 Rage.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative, gain 2 Rage.

description.p: Make an unarmed strike against yourself and gain 2 Rage.

sheet.description: Make an unarmed strike against yourself and gain 2 Rage.

description.p: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score instead.

sheet.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score instead.

description.p: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4 and their maximum is now 25.

sheet.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4 and their maximum is now 25.

description.p: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Choose a Lightsaber Form that defines your combat style and grants you unique abilities.
Choose a feat to further customize your character.
Dueling and Learn Riposte
Gain the Dueling Fighting Style

sheet.description: Gain the Dueling Fighting Style

description.p: Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

sheet.description: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

description.p: Learn Block and Learn Deflect
Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction
Block to negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

sheet.description: Block to negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

description.p: Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction

Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

description.p: Learn Force Leap and Learn Slow Fall
Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Action

Jump up to twice your movement and make a melee weapon attack. This does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you can jump an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: Jump up to twice your movement and make a melee weapon attack. This does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you can jump an additional 5 feet.

description.p: Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction
Use the Force to slow yourself when falling, taking only half fall damage.

sheet.description: Use the Force to slow yourself when falling, taking only half fall damage.

description.p: Learn Redirect
Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction

Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to send a ranged attack that would have hit you to a creature. This counts as a ranged Force attack with the range of the incoming attack. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to send a ranged attack that would have hit you to a creature. This counts as a ranged Force attack with the range of the incoming attack. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

description.p: Learn Passionate Strike and Learn Deflect
Cost: 2 Rage
Action Type: Action
Make a melee attack and gain advantage on that attack.

sheet.description: Make a melee attack and gain advantage on that attack.

description.p: Cost: 1 Rage
Action Type: Reaction

Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

description.p: Force Push and Force Pull as a Bonus Action
You can use Force Push and Force Pull as a Bonus Action.

sheet.description: You can use Force Push and Force Pull as a Bonus Action.

description.p: Learn Cyclone
Cost: 2 Rage
Action Type: Action

Make a flurry of attacks in one swift movement. You make two attacks that count as one attack against the same target. You roll both to hit. Per 2 extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you make an additional attack within that flurry.

sheet.description: Make a flurry of attacks in one swift movement. You make two attacks that count as one attack against the same target. You roll both to hit. Per 2 extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you make an additional attack within that flurry.
